text: Jao Tsung-I or Rao Zongyi (; 9 August 1917 â€“ 6 February 2018) was a Hong Kong- based Chinese sinologist, calligrapher and painter. Jao helped create many fields of humanities, including history, archaeology, epigraphy, folklores, religion, art history, musicology, literature, and Near Eastern Studies. He published more than 100 books and about 1,000 academic articles over a career spanning more than 80 years.
